meanings.definition: A person who practices or is devoted to rituals.
meanings.sent1: The ritualists gathered at the temple every full moon to perform their ceremonies.
meanings.sent2: The small village had a few dedicated ritualists who led the traditional prayers.
meanings.sent3: The ritualists decided to have a dance-off instead of their usual ceremony, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The ritualists were like bees in a hive, each one knowing their part in the intricate ritual.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ritualists chanting under the starlit sky stayed with me long after I left.

meanings.definition: A group or sect that adheres strictly to rituals.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe was known as the ritualists for their unwavering commitment to their customs.
meanings.sent2: The ritualists of the monastery followed a strict schedule of prayers and meditations.
meanings.sent3: The ritualists insisted on wearing matching socks every Thursday, much to the amusement of the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The ritualists' adherence to tradition was like a fortress, unyielding to modern influences.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ritualists in their ceremonial robes was a sight to behold, a living tapestry of tradition.
